Case reference: 2012020163.CaseDesc: An adult male was recovered from the water at Duval Point.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Brown with grey streaks

Case reference: 2014001826.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1960, Andrew Moses was last seen as he left his base camp on Brunswick Lake in Algoma County, Ontario. Andrew had left the base camp to check his trap line, which was approximately 5 miles in length near Ericson Creek. On November 13, 1960, a small search group was formed when Andrew did not return. The group located a rifle belonging to Andrew leaning against a tree. The following day, a half eaten beaver was located inside of a nearby camp on Ericson creek. The camp and trap line were searched one year later, and it revealed that it was vacant with no signs of being visited.

Case reference: 2011005799.CaseDesc: On June 20, 2011 Ibrahim Sendaigre was driving on Highway 17 between Terrace Bay and Marathon, Ontario.  He was involved in a motor vehicle accident and fled the scene into the bush area. Police searches of the area yielded negative results. Mr. Sendaigre has not been located and has had no contact with family or friends. Last Seen: Highway 17, Tuuri Township.  Approximately 4 km west of the Steel River bridge near Black Fox Lake.  This area is essentially located between the towns of Marathon and Terrace Bay, in Northwestern Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001664.CaseDesc: On September 12, 1982, Harold Larcher and his girlfriend set out in separate canoes with their supplies. Both canoes displayed their own leaks. After the river, they saw waves on the lake. The canoes began filling with water from these same waves.  Harold's girlfriends’ canoe sunk but she could see he was still in his canoe as she was struggling to right her own. She was unable to do so, but at one point was able to sit on top of it. Eventually she made her way to shore, however she did not see Harold again.  Numerous personal items belonging to Harold were recovered including his Passport and a life jacket that could have been his.  It is presumed Mr.Larcher drowned.

Case reference: 2005006699.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2003, an unidentified man believed to be between 50 and 60 years old, was found in the woods off of Humberwood Boulevard, near Highway 427 and Rexdale Blvd., in Toronto. He was found beneath an overturned picnic table that he may have been using for shelter. His post-mortem length was reported to be between 5’0"-5’1" and his weight was 122lbs. Found within the vicinity of his body was a right black leather-type boot, a black sock, a white baseball hat, a green winter jacket, a navy-coloured winter jacket, a black long-sleeved shirt, a black belt and an empty bottle of Listerine mouthwash. It is believed that death occurred within 1-2 days of his discovery.

Teeth: Visible Missing, He has multiple teeth missing with only one tooth remaining in his lower jaw
Other: Lighter and bus ticket in pocket
Boots: Leather, Black, Left boot only, size 9

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2014004183.CaseDesc: Virginia Sampare was last seen on October 14, 1971. Ms. Sampare was despondent over the death of her boyfriend. Ms. Sampare left the residence in the evening of that date and was not seen again.

Shirt: Cotton, Short sleeve navy blue shirt

Case reference: 2014001219.CaseDesc: On August 25, 1994, the remains of a man were found in Cates Park in North Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had a healed fracture to his right wrist and may have had an old injury to the lower back. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.  Police are investigating this case as a suspicious death.

Belt: Beige, Khaki, webbed with brass buckle

Case reference: 2020022042.CaseDesc: On January 10, 1996, the body of a man believed to be between the ages of 30-40 was found in a hotel room in downtown Quebec City, Quebec. The man expressed himself in English and he had with him a travel bag containing several personal belongings, suggesting that he came from outside the region or country.

Hair: Brown, Curly, Short, Shaved on sides, curly on top
Watch: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Gold, Brand GUESS

Case reference: 2007003599.CaseDesc: On October 2, 2000 Marilyn Zaitzeff left her cottage located on Lambert Island, Lake Superior. She was operating a personal watercraft at the time. The watercraft was located overturned several hundred metres away from the cottage. Mrs. Zaitzeff has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000068.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1994, Yvon Ringuet was reported missing from his home in the Rosemont-La Petite-Patrie district in Montreal, Quebec. Yvon would call or visit his mother everyday. All his personal belongings were found in his home and no one has seen or heard from him since.

Tattoo: Cross, right or left upper arm

Case reference: 2016061850.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1978, the body of a male was found in the snow on the east side of the Bayview Extension, near the east end of Labatt Ave, on the west bank of the Don River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 158lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Unshaven, beard and moustache
Pyjama: Blue, White, Blue and white patterned pyjama bottoms
Coat: Dark grey winter coat with a checkered pattern
Scarf: Black, blue and red plaid scarf
Shirt: Maroon, Black, Maroon and black sport shirt
Scar: Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars on a forearm
Abdomen, Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars
Shoulders, Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars
Mark: Left Hip, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Left Arm, Number of unswollen red-brown, circular contusions
Right Arm, Number of unswollen red-brown, circular contusions
Left Abdomen, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Right Leg, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Left Thigh, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
3 scabbed abrasions around the left eye orbit.

Case reference: 2020008538.CaseDesc: In mid-June 1976, Peter Vollar was last seen by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario. Peter had advised he was heading to London, Ontario for two weeks to seek job opportunities. All of his personal belongings were left behind.

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2002005560.CaseDesc: On July 2, 1975, at approximately 8:30 p.m., Michelle Wedge returned to her residence, but left shortly afterwards. Her bicycle was later located at the intersection of John and Dominion Street, which was not far from her residence in Moncton, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2014004296.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2002, Lowell Flett was reported missing by his employer as he had failed to show up for work for the 5th day. Lowell was last seen by his girlfriend, on November 16th. He left the residence on his ski-doo and has not been seen since. Despite intensive land and water searches neither Mr. Flett nor his ski-doo have been located. He is presumed to have drowned as a result of his sled falling through the ice.

Case reference: 2014001782.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1972, Kenneth Kay was seen for the last time as he attended the First Nation Treaty days in Quinton, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2013000059.CaseDesc: Normand Pellerin was last seen on July 4, 1999, at a fireworks show in the vicinity of the Jacques-Cartier Bridge in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005110.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2008, at approximately 9:25 p.m., Jaquelyn Latto was seen for the last time as she left the Juliette Place Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Jaquelyn had told the staff at the shelter that she was going out with her brother.

Case reference: 2019002992.CaseDesc: On August 25, 2018, Anupama Nadagouda was seen for the last time with her daughter, Anvita Mulemane, in India.

Case reference: 2014029389.CaseDesc: Jed Ouillette was last seen on the afternoon of September 8, 2014. Personal identification items were left behind at his residence. Mr. Ouillette had lost his driver's license due to medical issues involving seizures and was in financial difficulty.

Case reference: 2016066676.CaseDesc:
Between August 6th and August 13th, 1969, several body parts, believed to belong to the same male individual, were recovered from the water around the Ontario Hydro Forebay, Niagara Falls.
His eyes are brown with very prominent arcus senilis (ring-shaped grayish-white deposit near the peripheral edge of the cornea). His appendix and gall bladder are present. This individual was estimated to have been in the water for at least a few days to a week prior to recovery.

Hair: Grey, White, Facial hair a few days growth in length
Teeth: 1 post. tooth in upper jaw; few missing lower jaw. Teeth: dirty, carious & marked periodontitis. No evidence of dental work

Case reference: 2014046118.CaseDesc: The partial remains of an adult male were found on Little Shell Island near Sidney, British Columbia in 2012. The man’s age was estimated between 20 and 60 years old, and may have gone missing many years earlier.

Case reference: 2014005643.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2008, it was reported a boat had capsized in Lake Winnipeg, 15 miles south east of Poplar River between Marchand Point and George Island. The boat left Poplar Point on Oct 20, 2008, to remove buoys from Lake Winnipeg. During the evening, the boat experienced technical difficulties and was unable to continue. Throughout the early morning hours the weather began to worsen, experiencing 10 foot waves, at this time the vessel started to take in water. As a result the boat began to sink. Two of the three passengers were able to make it to Marchand's Point where they were rescued. No foul play is suspected and it is presumed George Donald Everett drowned.

Jacket: Nylon, Black, zippered Bomber style with "Berens River" patch on back

Case reference: 2012020114.CaseDesc: Sebastien Metivier went missing in Montreal on November 1, 1984. The young boy was in front of the Tres-Saint-Nom-de-Jesus church on the east side of the city. He was heading to an arts and crafts course.

Pants: Blue, Patch on the right knee

Case reference: 2012020033.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1997, Daniel Gaulton went out with some friends to the Park Hotel. He had called his place of work to take the day off from his job as a security guard at a local construction site. At approximately 9:00 p.m. Daniel went to an ATM and withdrew cash. At around 11:00 p.m. he returned home. He had a brief conversation with his roommate, and left in his 1985 Chrysler LeBaron.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, head of a wolf (black) set in a moon (orange)

Case reference: 2016066673.CaseDesc: On May 29, 1982, a disarticulated left foot was found washed up on the shore of Lake Simcoe, in front of the Shore Room Tavern (at the end of the 10th Concession of Innisfil Township). It has been estimated to have been in the water 1-5 years.

Shoes: Brown, Two-tone brown lace-up, size 9D shoe

Case reference: 2017063397.CaseDesc: On October 10, 2017, Brandon Cairney was seen for the last time in Vancouver, British Columbia, after travelling from his home in Port Alberni on Vancouver Island.  Brandon is known to go on hikes that cover long distances and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Back Of Head, Along the spine

Case reference: 2020004223.CaseDesc: On December 24, 2019, Ryan Docherty was seen for the last time by his family in London, Ontario. The last known contact between Ryan and his friends was during the last week of December. On March 6, 2020, his mother reported him missing after returning from an extended trip, and noticing that Ryan had not shown up at her residence to retrieve some cheques.

Tattoo: Upper Back, Words: "EAZY-E"; gun and bullet
Left Hand, A heart with the name "Jodi"
Left Wrist, 6 eyes inside a triangle
Chest, Doc and Pennywise the clown
Scar: Right Hand, 3 inches on the top

Case reference: 2014001087.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2001, a woman was found dead near the Allan Memorial Pavilion at the Royal Victoria Hospital in Montreal. With the help of a forensic artist, a face reconstruction was made. The woman wore gray clothes similar to those used by hospital patients.

Shoes: White, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, "Aerocourt" running shoes brand, size 8

Case reference: 2006015199.CaseDesc: Robert Asher was last seen in Dunnville, Ontario during the winter of 1982. He has not been seen since. Mr. Asher may have been despondent at the time of his disappearance. His vehicle has not been recovered. Mr. Asher was involved with illicit drugs and alcohol at the time of his disappearance.

Jewelry: Gold, Necklace with a diamond ring attached

Case reference: 2014005677.CaseDesc: On September 21, 2011, John Fadden was last seen in the University Endowment Lands, British Columbia.  He also suffered from dementia.

Case reference: 2018054173.CaseDesc: On September 23, 2018, at approximately 11:00am, Melvin Hillier was last seen at his home in Torbay, Newfoundland. Mr. Hillier had advised his family that he was going for a drive. Melvin’s blue pick-up truck was later located abandoned on the MV Legionnaire (one of the ferries that operates between Portugal Cove-St. Phillips and Bell Island, Newfoundland). Surveillance footage of the ferry shows Melvin walking around the lounge area during 1:45pm crossing. He was last observed on video between 1:50pm and 1:57pm.

Case reference: 2009005299.CaseDesc: David Chevrier suffers from schizophrenia and functions at a low intellectual level. He was last seen at the Centre of Friends on Main street in North Bay.

Case reference: 2018063446.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1990, Ian MacKay was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Ian’s brother had not heard from him in three years before he reported him missing.

Case reference: 2014001592.CaseDesc: Robert Mc Sween was reported missing by a family member on October 14, 1994. He was last seen September 18, 1994. The last contact he had with his family was by phone at the beginning of October 1994. Details of the coming and goings of Mr. Mc Sween are unknown by family members. His vehicle was found abandoned in the yard of a restaurant in Montreal.

Case reference: 2012020080.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2004, at 11:30 p.m., Courtney Struble, 13 years old, was last seen walking towards her residence in Estevan, SK. There have been reported sightings of Courtney, however, despite investigations and searches, she has not been located.

Mark: Neck, birthmark at nape of neck

Case reference: 2014005682.CaseDesc: On September 27, 2011, Bernard Wierzba was seen for the last time as he swam with a friend near the Manola Bridge in Barrhead County, Alberta. During this time, Bernard was not wearing a life jacket and he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2021030286.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2021 Mona Hu was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Mona had been in contact with her family in China, and was arranging to travel to see them.

Case reference: 2012020158.CaseDesc: This adult male was witnessed collapsing in the 400 block of Powell Street in East Vancouver. He was pronounced dead upon arrival to hospital.

Case reference: 2019019954.CaseDesc: On April 14, 2019, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Yonis and Mawahib Ahmed were seen for the last time with their mother Liyana Abdow at the Sojourn House in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006010999.CaseDesc: It is believed that Sander Lingman became lost while staking claims near Gripp Lake, 69 kilometres north west of Nakina, Ontario. They were unable to find Mr Lingman, despite intensive searches of the area.

Case reference: 2014004547.CaseDesc: Ervin Moar is transient in nature and is known to frequent the Main Street strip of Winnipeg, MB. Mr. Moar has not been seen or heard from since June 3, 2004.

Case reference: 2014016772.CaseDesc: On July 6, 2014 around 1PM, Yvon Guevin left his residence in Pierreville, Quebec with his vehicle, a burgundy and gray Jeep Cherokee registered in Quebec. He left with his little black dog, a "miniature Pinscher" named Costaud. His family and friends have not seen or heard from him since, which is out of the ordinary.

Case reference: 2021018831.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2021, Noelle O’Soup was seen for the last time in Coquitlam, British Columbia. Noelle is known to frequent the Downtown Eastside District in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Sweater: Black, Yellow, black or yellow hooded sweater

Case reference: 2014002978.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1982, a witness saw Louisette ST-ARNEAULT fall from the Laviolette Bridge in Trois-Rivières. Her body was never recovered.

Case reference: 2014006470.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2001, Shahzad Ahmed was seen for the last time at his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Shahzad last contacted his mother by telephone to tell her that he had been fired from his job. During the course of their conversation, his mother had told him to return home to her apartment in Toronto, but he never arrived. The next telephone call that Shahzad’s mother received was from the Islamabad police in Pakistan, who had informed her that Shahzad’s luggage had been found unclaimed on the airport luggage carousel.

Case reference: 2014031015.CaseDesc: A male was located, deceased in a wooded area near the Halifax International Airport. No identification was located in the area. A composite sketch and reconstruction model of the male have been developed, however the male remains unidentified.

Case reference: 2006010299.CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.

Case reference: 2014005583.CaseDesc: Mary Mark was a resident of east Vancouver in the 1970's. She did not apply for any government-issued identification or obtain social assistance, so information is very sparse on Mrs. Mark's life after 1975. It is believed that she met with foul play as the result of domestic violence. Her body was never recovered and the suspect is now deceased.

Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2006009399.CaseDesc: Patrick Ukrainetz departed his mother's house in St. Isidore, Ontario which he did periodically, but always returned.  On December 26, 2001, Mr. Ukrainetz was captured on a video surveillance camera at a bank in St. Sauveur, in the Province of Quebec. There has not been any other activity on the bank account since that time and he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006001299.CaseDesc:
On July 6, 1991, the body of an adult male was recovered from Lake Ontario near the east end of Harbour Square Park, at the foot of Bay Street.
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being in between 169-178lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is described as having a muscular build. 

He is believed to have been in the water for a few days to a couple of weeks prior to his discovery.

Hair: Black, Curly, Short, Short black beard and a moustache
Teeth: Many amalgam restorations, 3rd molars: absent, Unusual acrylic bridge: U-right middle incisor 2 artif. crowns. Poss. temporary
Shirt: Yellow, Brown, Light brown or mustard coloured long-sleeved shirt.
Shoes: Blue, Low-cut Adidas running shoes, approximately size 10.
Pants: Blue, Track pants with the word "REEBOK" on the left leg and an American flag.

Case reference: 2016026672.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1978, a Caucasian male was found in the woods bounded by Hwy 169, the CN Railway tracks and the Black River (Lot 26/27 Concession L, Rama Township) in Washago, Ontario. He had stains on his teeth which suggest he was a smoker. He is believed to have been dead for 1-5 years.

Teeth: His teeth were well cared for and had extensive conservative dental restorations.

Case reference: 2014005841.CaseDesc: Alfred Sassin has not been seen since he left his home in downtown Vancouver on July 9, 2012. Mr. Sassin's absence was reported to police by the resident caretakers on July 16, as they had not seen him for over a week, which was unusual for him.

Case reference: 2014005592.CaseDesc: The Timmins Police Service is actively investigating a historical missing person case involving the disappearance of William “Billy” Chookomolin. Mr. Chookomolin went missing from Timmins in the spring of 1995 at the age of 47.

Case reference: 2016069147.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1974, the body of a Caucasian male was found on the CNR tracks, 200 yards west of the CNR Station, Hearst. A witness observed the remains on the tracks after an advancing train had passed. His post-mortem length was recorded as being 5’8” however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was described as having a medium build. He may have been wearing glasses according to police reports.

Teeth: Good, Missing upper left 3rd molar. Several of his upper and lower posterior teeth had amalgam restorations.

Case reference: 2014002983.CaseDesc: On the 14th of June, 1986, Joseph MAJOR, 75 years old, was reported missing from a care home in the Hudson Bay district, SK. Extensive ground searches of the area failed to locate Mr. MAJOR.

Case reference: 2018041254.CaseDesc: On July 10, 2018, Ashley Morin was last seen leaving a house, on foot, in North Battleford, Saskatchewan

Case reference: 2012020168.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area near Chase, approximately 300 meters east of Highway 446, 2 km north of Squilax Bridge.

Teeth: Visible Missing, This male was missing a number of teeth prior to his death and had poor dental health
Socks: Cotton, White, Black, athletic/sport, black stripe
Shoes: Leather, Tan, loafers, size 9.5 or 10 mens
Pants: Cotton, Blue, casual, size 32, South Channel
Jewelry: Metal, Blue, White, a square pin with Expo 86
Fractured/Broken Bones: Nose, Healed nasal septum fracture likely causing breathing problems and a bump on right side of nose

Case reference: 2014001166.CaseDesc: On September 12, 2005 a man entered the Royal Victoria Hospital. He identified himself verbally as John Boudreau or Boudreault with the date of birth 1943-09-23, to the hospital attendants. No proof of identity could be made. The man was homeless but not known to local organizations.

Case reference: 2014005317.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1996, Sabrina John was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sabrina’s parents had gotten into an argument that night, and the following day she and her mother had left their home with their clothing.

Case reference: 2014001464.CaseDesc: On the evening of August 16, 1989, Vincent Greene entered a wooded area behind his residence on the Red Head Rd, Saint John, NB, to search for the family dog. The dog returned shortly after he had left, but Vincent never returned.  An extensive ground search was conducted with negative results. Anyone with information is urged to contact the Saint John Police Force.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Steel rimmed
Jewelry: Gold, Wedding Ring, Lines on both sides

Case reference: 1999108210.CaseDesc: René Bessette was abducted when he was 8 years old by his father, Roger Bessette, leaving behind his mother and siblings.  His father's car was found abandoned later on the Victoria Bridge in Montreal.  The photos of René have been age-progressed to 40 years old.

Case reference: 2014001090.CaseDesc: On July 22, 1973, the body of a healthy Caucasian adult male believed to be between the ages of 30-49 was discovered in the Pacific Spirit Regional Park in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had a significant amount of high quality dental work, including several extracted teeth. It is believed he died on or around June 30, 1973 and may have been despondent when he was last seen alive.

Shirt: Cloth, Blue, Mens Store in Toronto brand, button-down
Jewelry: Metal, Gold, Timex, Mens Wrist Watch

Case reference: 2014003232.CaseDesc: Warren Grundy was reported missing from Edmonton, Alberta, in June 1983. Warren's personal identification and clothing were later found near the North Saskatchewan river bank below the High Level Bridge in Edmonton. Warren may have been sighted in Ontario two and a half years after he disappeared. There was also suggestion that he may have travelled to Ohio, USA.

Case reference: 2014006037.CaseDesc: On March 21, 2013, Bruno Pouliot went to a medical appointment. Later that evening, Bruno was last seen in a pharmacy located in Saint-Pierre-de-l’île-d’Orléans, Québec. Bruno lived in the Donnacona area and was known to go snowshoeing on the frozen St. Lawrence River.

Case reference: 2014001743.CaseDesc: Knut Thielemann was last seen walking near the Athabasca Falls in Jasper National Park.

Case reference: 2014004882.CaseDesc: On September 20, 2003, at approximately 10:00 am, Feng Lin was seen for the last time after he parked his car at 295 Ossington Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Scar: Shoulders, Two on the upper left

Case reference: 2021008992.CaseDesc: On March 7, 2021, Konstantin Boukhanov travelled to Toronto, Ontario without telling his family. Konstantin has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006010599.CaseDesc: William Wabie was last seen as he departed in his 16 foot Starcraft boat from Bag Bay Peninsula, Shoal Lake, near Kenora, Ontario.  Mr. Wabie never arrived at his destination of Cedar Island.

Hat: Straw, Feather on the on side

Case reference: 2016018567.CaseDesc: Mekayla was last seen at the STC Bus Depot in Yorkton at 1:45 p.m. on April 12, 2016. She went to school in the morning, but left shortly after arriving. She went to several businesses in Yorkton throughout the morning, then returned to school around noon. She bought lunch at the restaurant in the bus depot, but did not get on a bus that day. Mekayla left the bus depot in the early afternoon and hasn't been seen since.

Case reference: 2017013180.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2017, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Maryam Mehrvarz and Kian Norouzian were seen last seen together in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020007818.CaseDesc: On August 11, 1972, at approximately 12:00pm, Harvey Tulley was seen for the last time by the building’s superintendent in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Harvey was despondent.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Thumb, Bent towards index finger

Case reference: 2014001337.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1983, Micheline Chailler was seen for the last time at her apartment in Lévis, Quebec. Micheline last contacted a member of her family by telephone on March 19, 1983. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Brown, Beige, Brown with beige stripes

Case reference: 2012020061.CaseDesc: On the evening of October 17, 2008, Amber Mcfarland went to Smitty's lounge with her boyfriend and an acquaintance of his. There they socialized with friends for a while and then moved to the bar at the Canad Inn. They left Amber's vehicle at the Canad Inn and went to the Cat and Fiddle Bar where they continued to socialize. Video surveillance at the bar confirms that shortly after 1:00 am on October 18, 2008, Amber, her boyfriend and his acquaintance entered the attached beer vendor and purchased a case of beer. The three of them exited the vendor and walked into the parking lot. Amber has not been seen or heard from since. All of Amber's cell phone activity and bank activity has since ceased.

Purse: White, Black, Checkered or plaid pattern

Case reference: 2012020031.CaseDesc: Michael Feist's fully operational car was found abandoned near Cherhill, Alberta.  Mr. Feist is known to have well-developed survival skills. Police investigations regarding Mr. Feist's whereabouts are currently ongoing.

Case reference: 2013000093.CaseDesc: On July 10, 1989, Arlene Gagne was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Arlene told her husband that she wanted to stay home for the day. When her husband came back, Arlene was not home. All of her personal belongings were left at home.

Case reference: 2007004499.CaseDesc: Rod Pavan was last heard from on August 10, 2007. Mr. Pavan advised his landlord that he was moving to British Columbia that day. His vehicle was later found near Shannon Lake Road, north of Val Cote, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004565.CaseDesc: On December 1, 2004, Jack Day left Fort McMurray, Alberta, for an unknown destination. On December 4, 2004, Mr. Day's abandoned vehicle was discovered at Chrystina Lake Provincial Recreational area near Swan Hills, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2014004533.CaseDesc: On October 29, 1985, Jonathan Molina was seen for the last time in a vehicle in the White Bear First Nation near Carlyle, Saskatchewan. The following year, on October 1, 1986, the skeletal remains of Jonathan’s mother and infant sibling were found in close proximity of the vehicle. Searches to find Jonathan have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2014005103.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2008, Mathieu Duguay was seen for the last time while shouting for help in Rivière-des-Prairies in Montreal, Quebec. Some of Mathieu’s personal belongings were found on the banks of the river, not far from where witnesses saw the young man disappear into the river currents. Extensive searches of the area were conducted, but he was never found.

Hat: White, Baseball cap, possibly with Montreal Expos baseball team logo

Case reference: 2014003930.CaseDesc: On May 15, 1979, Murray Johnson was last seen boarding a train at 07:45 a.m. in Belleville, Ontario. He was presumed to be travelling West. Murray also had a noticeable curvature of his back. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Right Calf, War wound, skin is bunched up

Case reference: 2012020060.CaseDesc: Rene Mazerolle was last seen on July 28, 2008 when he was discharged from the Health Sciences Centre in Winnipeg.  Mr. Mazerolle's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2006025299.CaseDesc: Eetu Vainonen has been missing from the Thunder Bay (Port Arthur) area since sometime during 1935 to 1936.

Case reference: 2014002414.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1983, Michael Milavanov and his father were canoeing on Kingsmere Lake near Waskesiu, SK. The canoe tipped over in rough water. His father survived however searches failed to locate Michael Milavanov.

Case reference: 2014004707.CaseDesc: On June 17, 1986, Paul Leduc was going to the family cottage at Lake Duhamel in the Saint Jovite, Mont Tremblant area. He has not been seen since. His vehicle and personal belongings were found at the cottage. His canoe containing paddles and a life jacket was found adrift on the lake near the cottage.

Case reference: 2016068443.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1980, an arm was recovered from Lake Erie, on the beach in front of 400 Cooper Lane in Amherstburg. The remains were thought to be probably female. The time since death is probably no more than one year.

Case reference: 2006021099.CaseDesc: Roy Britten was last seen in a 14-foot aluminum boat in the Birch Beach area heading toward the northeast part of Caribou Island, Lake Superior, Ontario.  He is presumed drowned.

Jacket: Blue, Thunder Bay Police Force Association

Case reference: 2014003814.CaseDesc: On April 27, 1980, Leon Kitchekesik and his parents were staying at their cabin on Gull Lake. Leon was walking along the shore with his three year old sister. The parents went to investigate when they heard the screams of their daughter. The parents located footprints approaching a small hole and none leading away from the hole. There was a land search conducted however it is felt the boy drowned.

Case reference: 2014002118.CaseDesc: Henry M’Lot was reported missing by his brother on November 13, 1973. At the time of his disappearance, he was despondent due to the separation with his wife.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Head, Burr hole from operation right front side of skull

Case reference: 2010001799.CaseDesc: On the morning of May 18, 1993, Christine Harron stayed home from school as she was not feeling well. Around lunch time Christine and her mother argued about Christine returning to school for the afternoon. Her mother heard Christine leave the house at about 1:30 pm. Christine did not attend school that afternoon and she has not been seen since. The investigation revealed that Christine left the house without her purse, money or knapsack. Subsequent investigation has led to the arrest and conviction of a male in regards to the disappearance of Christine Harron, however her remains have yet to be located.

Glasses: Plastic, Brown, Large rimmed with tape

Case reference: 2014002786.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1975, Gaétan Poulin was seen for the last time leaving his family home in Montreal, Quebec, to go to a bar.

Case reference: 2014001002.CaseDesc:
On June 27, 1979, the remains of a male were recovered from the Lower Niagara River about one mile south of the Boy Scout Camp and four miles from the St. Catharines Boat Club. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 150-160 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was recovered without clothing or jewelry. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks prior to discovery.

Hair: Brown, Thin dark "Fu Manchu" type mustache
Teeth: Anterior teeth in very good condition, no fillings. Posterior teeth signs of decay and wisdom teeth are absent.

Case reference: 2008023599.CaseDesc: Gordon Andrew Cameron was reported missing by a family member on March 26, 1993. He was last seen on February 28, at Lino's Restaurant and has not been seen or heard from since.  At the time of his disappearance he was self-employed as an auto-body repairman. His shop was located at Brule Road and Highway 2 in Kingston. Foul play is suspected in his disappearance.

Case reference: 2005069040.CaseDesc: Yaseen is believed to be with his mother, Marina Zlonikova. They may be in the Ukraine.

Case reference: 2010003999.CaseDesc: During the evening of Friday May 28, 1999, Tammy Lamondin, age 20,  was with friends on Main Street in Newmarket. She remained in their company until sometime after midnight. In the early morning hours of May 29, 1999, Tammy left the Newmarket area with a male acquaintance. She was not seen again. The police conducted an investigation but were not able to locate her.

Tattoo: Right Ankle, Dolphin above right ankle

Case reference: 2021035166.CaseDesc: On July 10, 2021, Nicole Frenchman was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Nicole was living with her friends, but had no fixed address. Nicole was normally very active on social media but has not accessed it since her disappearance.

Tattoo: Left Side Of Neck, Leopard print
Right Side Of Neck, Red kiss lips
Right Hand, "Queen dubs dollar sign" on the middle finger
Right Forearm, Dreamcatcher; feathers; "Trust no one"
Pierce: Upper Lip, Monroe piercing on left side

Case reference: 2006024299.CaseDesc: Harold Cottrell was last seen on September 28, 1984, in a boat on Northwind Lake.  It is believed the aluminum boat he was travelling in with some companions, was overloaded.  The boat began to sink.  Mr. Cottrell was never located and is presumed to have drowned.
